intro: Dicalix oligophlebius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dicalix, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are narrow and often have a leathery texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
